constraints.reason: All agents are US residents by simulation definition

grounding.source: Simulation spec: US population only
grounding.note: Universally 'United States' per the simulation scope statement

constraints.reason: Practical upper bound for living US adults; centenarians are <0.1% of population

grounding.source: US Census Bureau 2024 national population estimates (census.gov); U.S. median age 39+ overall, ~47 for adult-only population
grounding.note: Median US age surpassed 39 in 2024 per Census (census.gov/library/stories/2025/06/metro-areas-median-age.html). Adult-only median is higher (~46-48). Normal approximation is reasonable; real distribut...[truncated]

grounding.source: US Census Bureau Vintage 2024 via theworlddata.com; 2020 Census (wikipedia Demographics of US); Williams Institute UCLA non-binary estimates (~1.2-1.4%)
grounding.note: 2020 Census: females 50.9%, males 49.1% of total. 2025 estimates show near-parity (50.24% male, 49.76% female) due to immigration shifts. Non-binary/Other ~1.2-1.6% per UCLA Williams Institute. Adult ...[truncated]

grounding.source: US Census Bureau 2024 state population estimates (census.gov); proportional to each state's adult population
grounding.note: Weights are approximate proportions of US adult population by state. Top 5 states (CA, TX, FL, NY, PA) account for ~37% of US adults. DC included as distinct jurisdiction.

grounding.source: Pew Research Center 2025 (pewresearch.org/race-and-ethnicity/2025/11/03); ACS 2019-2023 neilsberg.com; US Census Vintage 2023 (census.gov/newsroom/press-releases/2024/population-estimates-characterist...[truncated]
grounding.note: 2020 Census: White non-Hispanic 57.8%, Hispanic 18.7%, Black 12.1%, Asian 5.9%, Other ~4.1%+. ACS 2023 5-yr: Hispanic 18.99%, Black 12.36%. Weights adjusted to sum to 1.0 with 'Other' encompassing AIA...[truncated]

grounding.source: Big Five personality meta-analyses (Costa & McCrae; Soto et al. 2011 JPSP; Cross-cultural Big Five norms); US adult population means
grounding.note: Openness in US adults has population mean ~0.5 with moderate SD (~0.15). Beta(7.5,7.5) gives symmetric distribution centered at 0.5 with most mass in [0.2,0.8]. Real distribution is approximately norm...[truncated]

grounding.source: Soto et al. (2011) JPSP Big Five norms; Donnellan & Lucas (2008); US adult population typically scores above midpoint on Conscientiousness
grounding.note: US adults consistently score slightly above midpoint (~0.55-0.60) on Conscientiousness in population surveys. Beta(9,6) gives mean ~0.60 with SD ~0.13. Distribution is slightly left-skewed (more high-...[truncated]

grounding.source: Soto et al. (2011); Big Five International Item Pool norms; US typically slightly above midpoint on extraversion
grounding.note: US adults score slightly above midpoint on Extraversion (~0.48-0.52). Beta(7,7.5) gives mean ~0.48 with SD ~0.13. US is often cited as among higher extraversion nations but distribution is still rough...[truncated]

grounding.source: Soto et al. (2011) JPSP; Costa & McCrae NEO PI-R norms; Agreeableness higher in women and older adults in US samples
grounding.note: Agreeableness is typically the highest-scoring Big Five domain in US adults (~0.60). Beta(9.5,6.5) gives mean ~0.594 with SD ~0.13. Increases with age; women score higher than men. Mixed slightly towa...[truncated]

grounding.source: Soto et al. (2011); Terracciano et al. cross-cultural norms; Neuroticism declines with age in US samples
grounding.note: US adults score slightly below midpoint on Neuroticism (~0.40). Beta(6,9) gives mean ~0.40 with SD ~0.13. Distribution skewed toward lower neuroticism. Women score higher than men; young adults score ...[truncated]

grounding.source: US Census Bureau urban/rural classification 2020; Pew Research Center suburban/urban/rural surveys; ~80% of US population lives in metro areas
grounding.note: Census: ~80% live in urbanized areas but the suburban/urban split within that is estimated at ~55% suburban, ~31% urban core. Rural ~19.3% of population but ~14% of adults (rural population skews olde...[truncated]

grounding.source: US Census Bureau ACS 2023 Educational Attainment for Adults 25+ (census.gov); CPS 2024
grounding.note: ACS 2023 adults 25+: No HS diploma ~8.8%, HS grad ~27.0%, Some college (no degree) ~20%, Associate's ~9.5%, Bachelor's ~22.2%, Graduate ~12.7%. Adults 18-24 skew toward lower attainment but for simula...[truncated]

constraints.reason: Practical upper bound; captures top 0.01% without wild outliers distorting model

grounding.source: US Census Bureau CPS ASEC 2023; median household income ~$80,610 in 2023 (census.gov); lognormal is standard model for income distributions
grounding.note: Lognormal params: mean=11.0 (exp(11)~$60,000 geometric mean), std=0.85 on log scale gives median ~$60k, mean ~$89k which matches CPS data. US median HH income was $80,610 in 2023 (all HH); for adults ...[truncated]

grounding.source: US Census Bureau CPS 2023; ACS 2022-2023 marital status for adults 18+
grounding.note: CPS 2023 adults 18+: Never married ~32%, Married ~48%, Divorced ~11%, Widowed ~6%, Cohabiting ~3.4%. Widowed higher among older adults. Domestic partnership includes cohabiting/civil unions. Single = ...[truncated]

constraints.reason: At minimum the agent lives alone
Practical upper bound; extreme multi-generational households exist but >15 extremely rare

grounding.source: US Census Bureau CPS 2023; ACS 2023: average household size 2.53 persons
grounding.note: US average household size 2.53 in 2023. Distribution is right-skewed (many 1- and 2-person households, some large families). Normal approximation with hard_min=1 captures this. Post-sampling, round to...[truncated]

constraints.reason: Cannot have children in household if household_size < 2

grounding.source: US Census Bureau CPS 2023; ~28-30% of US households have own children under 18 present
grounding.note: CPS 2023: ~28% of all households have own children under 18. Among adults 18+, this is the household-level figure. Higher among 25-45 age group; nearly 0 for 65+. Reflects children under 18 in househo...[truncated]

grounding.source: BLS Current Employment Statistics 2024; BLS CPS 2024 labor force participation; employment-population ratio ~60.4%
grounding.note: BLS 2024: Employment-population ratio ~60.4%, unemployment rate ~3.7-4.0%. Self-employed ~9.5% of workforce. Retired accounts for large share (~22%) due to aging population. Student ~6.5% of adults 18...[truncated]

grounding.source: BLS Occupational Employment and Wage Statistics 2023 (bls.gov/oes); BLS occupational group employment shares
grounding.note: BLS 2023 major occupation groups: Management 10.7%, Professional 22.8%, Service 16.7%, Sales 14.7%, Construction/Extraction 9.0%, Production/Transportation 6.5%, Other (including admin support, transp...[truncated]

grounding.source: Gallup 2024 party affiliation data (news.gallup.com/poll/655157); Pew Research Center NPORS 2024-2025 (pewresearch.org/politics/fact-sheet/party-affiliation-fact-sheet-npors)
grounding.note: Gallup 2024: 28% Democrat, 28% Republican, 43% Independent (pure). Leaned: 46% R or R-lean, 45% D or D-lean. Pew NPORS: 31% Republican, 28% Democrat, 41% independent/other. Strong vs Lean split estima...[truncated]

grounding.source: Gallup 2023-2024 ideology tracking (news.gallup.com/poll/548459); Gallup 2025 annual average (35% conservative, 33% moderate, 28% liberal)
grounding.note: Gallup 2023: 36% conservative, 36% moderate, 25% liberal. Gallup 2025: 35% conservative, 33% moderate, 28% liberal. Very liberal/very conservative split estimated from ANES and GSS sub-categories (~8-...[truncated]

grounding.source: Pew Research Center 2023-24 Religious Landscape Study (pewresearch.org/religion/2025/02/26/religious-landscape-study-executive-summary); Gallup 2024 religious preferences (news.gallup.com/poll/659339)
grounding.note: Pew RLS 2023-24: Evangelical Protestant 23%, Mainline Protestant 11%, Catholic 19%, Other Christian 3-5%, Jewish 2%, Muslim 1%, Buddhist/Hindu/Other ~4%, Unaffiliated 29%. Gallup 2024: Protestant/nond...[truncated]

grounding.source: Pew Research Center 2023-24 RLS religious practice data; Gallup church attendance tracking 2022-2024; GSS 2022
grounding.note: Pew 2023-24 RLS: ~26% attend at least weekly, ~22% seldom/never attend. GSS 2022: ~21% weekly, ~33% never. Gallup 2024: weekly/nearly weekly ~20-22%. 'Never' ~26%, 'Seldom' ~17%, 'A few times/year' ~1...[truncated]

grounding.source: Pew Research Center 2024 news consumption survey; Reuters Institute Digital News Report 2024; Gallup media consumption data 2023-2024
grounding.note: Pew 2024: TV ~32% primary news source (declining), Online/Digital ~29% (growing), Social Media ~18-20%, Radio ~7%, Print ~4%, None/Other ~10-12%. Social media as primary news source growing esp. among...[truncated]

grounding.source: Pew Research Center 2023 news pathways and polarization report; Reuters Institute Digital News Report 2024; AllSides and Ad Fontes Media audience data
grounding.note: Estimated from cross-tabulation of political affiliation with reported outlet consumption. Fox News ~12-14% of adults as primary source (right-leaning). MSNBC/CNN ~12-15% (left). Network TV/AP/Reuters...[truncated]

grounding.source: Pew Research Center 2023-2024 Social Media Use surveys (pewresearch.org); Statista US social media platform reach 2024
grounding.note: Pew 2023: YouTube 83%, Facebook 68%, Instagram 47%, TikTok 33%, Twitter/X 22% of US adults use each. As PRIMARY platform: Facebook still dominant overall (older users), YouTube growing esp. cross-age,...[truncated]

constraints.reason: Practical maximum (waking hours spent on social media)

grounding.source: Pew Research Center 2023-24 social media time data; Statista/DataReportal 2024: US average social media time ~2.3 hours/day across all users
grounding.note: DataReportal 2024: US average social media use ~2.3 hrs/day across users. Lognormal with mean=0.85 (log scale), std=0.75 gives median ~exp(0.85)~2.3 hrs, with long right tail for heavy users. Includes...[truncated]

grounding.source: Pew Research Center 2024 internet access survey; FCC Broadband Deployment Report 2024; NTIA Internet Use Survey 2023
grounding.note: Pew 2024: ~77% of US adults have home broadband. ~7% are smartphone-only internet users. ~8% have no internet at home. ~4-5% have satellite/DSL/dial-up as primary. Broadband access has grown steadily;...[truncated]

grounding.source: US Elections Project voter turnout data 2020-2024; Census Bureau Voting and Registration Supplement CPS 2022-2024; CIRCLE youth civic engagement data
grounding.note: 2020 election turnout ~66.8% of eligible voters (highest since 1900). 2022 midterm ~46.8%. 2024 ~64%. Among registered voters, ~70-75% vote in presidential years. 'Regularly' votes ~41-43% (votes in p...[truncated]

grounding.source: US Census Bureau Housing Vacancies and Homeownership Survey (HVS) Q3 2024; homeownership rate 65.6%
grounding.note: Census Bureau HVS Q3 2024: US homeownership rate 65.6%. Varies significantly by age (18-34: ~38%, 65+: ~79%), race (White non-Hispanic ~73%, Black ~46%, Hispanic ~49%), and income. National rate is ro...[truncated]

grounding.source: KFF Health Insurance Coverage 2023; Census Bureau CPS ASEC 2023 health insurance data; CMS enrollment data 2023
grounding.note: KFF 2023: Employer-sponsored ~46.8%, Medicaid ~17%, Medicare ~15.5%, Individual market ~7%, Military/VA ~3.2%, Uninsured ~10.5%. Some overlap (dual coverage) handled by assigning primary source. Medic...[truncated]

grounding.source: US Census Bureau ACS 2023 nativity and citizenship status; CPS 2023 foreign-born population data
grounding.note: ACS 2023: Foreign-born ~14.3% of total US population (~47M). Of these: naturalized citizens ~52%, LPRs ~30%, other (visa, undocumented) ~18%. US-born ~85.7%. Adult proportion: US-born ~84.3%, Naturali...[truncated]

grounding.source: BLS Union Members Summary January 2024 (bls.gov/news.release/union2); union membership rate 10.0% in 2023
grounding.note: BLS: Union membership rate was 10.0% in 2023, down from 10.1% in 2022. Public sector rate 32.5%, private sector 6.0%. Applied to all adults (not just employed) means effective rate ~10% of adults who ...[truncated]

grounding.source: Pew Research Center 2023 gun ownership survey (pewresearch.org); Gallup 2023 gun ownership ~44% of households; NORC GSS 2022
grounding.note: Pew 2023: 32% of US adults personally own a gun; 44% live in gun-owning households. GSS 2022: ~32-34% household gun ownership. NORC/Gallup historically higher (~44%). Variation by method: self-report ...[truncated]

grounding.source: Gallup Confidence in Institutions 2023-2024 (news.gallup.com); Edelman Trust Barometer 2024 US data; Pew trust in government 2024
grounding.note: Gallup 2023-2024: Confidence in most US institutions at or near historical lows. Congress ~8-13%, media ~14-18%, presidency ~26-35%, SCOTUS ~25-40%. Edelman 2024 Trust Index for US ~47/100. Beta(3.5,6...[truncated]

grounding.source: Cacioppo & Petty NFC Scale meta-analyses; Fleischhauer et al. (2010); NFC correlates with education and openness in US samples
grounding.note: Need for Cognition (NFC) in general adult populations follows approximately normal distribution on the scale. Mean ~0.50, SD ~0.16. Beta(6,6) gives symmetric distribution centered at 0.5. NFC positive...[truncated]

grounding.source: Pennycook & Rand (2019, 2021) misinformation susceptibility research; Roozenbeek et al. (2022) inoculation studies; Reuters Institute Digital News Report 2023-2024 news literacy data
grounding.note: Susceptibility to misinformation inversely correlated with analytical thinking (NFC), education, and media literacy. Pennycook & Rand (2019) found ~25-30% of US adults regularly fail to discriminate r...[truncated]
